description: Late 16th century borrowing from New Latin glōttis, from Ancient Greek γλωττῐ́ς (glōttís, “mouth of the windpipe”), from γλῶττᾰ (glôtta, “tongue”) +‎ -ῐς (-is, feminine noun suffix). Cognates include Latin gula.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The opening between the true vocal cords which is located in the larynx and affects voice modulation through expansion or contraction.
